headline.main: BOSTON.; The Weather--Camp Lincoln--Gov. Washburn--Rebaking the Military--Boston Bay and its Islands--The Common--The Public Gardens--British Deseriers Protected.

docs.lead_paragraph: The weather has grown cool for some days past, and people have recovered from the perspiring torpors in which they lately found themselves, with the glass simmering at fever heat, in the tenth decade.
docs.snippet: The weather has grown cool for some days past, and people have recovered from the perspiring torpors in which they lately found themselves, with the glass simmering at fever heat, in the tenth decade.

headline.main: The Oldest Clergyman in the United States

docs.lead_paragraph: A correspondent of the New-York Evansgelist gives an interesting account of Rev. JOHN SAWYER, of Garland, Maine, who is doubtless the oldest officiating elergyman in this country. "Father" SAWVER will be ninety-nine years old next October.
docs.snippet: A correspondent of the New-York Evansgelist gives an interesting account of Rev. JOHN SAWYER, of Garland, Maine, who is doubtless the oldest officiating elergyman in this country. "Father" SAWVER will be ninety-nine years old next October.
